DOC.brief_title: A Study Denufosol Tetrasodium Intravitreal Injection Subjects With Post Cataract Extraction Macular Edema
DOC.criteria: Have persistent post cataract extraction macular edema whose condition stable Have change medication regimen immunosuppressive antiinflammatory agent ; steroidal nonsteroidal agent specified period time prior randomization Have least one eligible eye treat study Have optical coherence tomography ( OCT ) scan qualify retinal thickness study eye Have macular edema confirm fluorescein angiography Have proliferative vitreoretinopathy great grade B either eye Have ocular disorder study eye may confound interpretation study result Have ophthalmic disorder study eye may influence final visual acuity and/or fluorescein angiography interpretation Have cataract surgery study eye past 2 month , YAG laser capsulotomy within past 1 month , intraocular surgery within past 90 day Have uncontrollable elevate intraocular pressure ( IOP ) advance glaucoma Have periocular intravitreal injection corticosteroid study eye within 3 month Have ocular implant device delivery therapeutic agent Be take excluded medication could obscure confound study result
